byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Edward Wong from Wuhan, China. Kiki Zhao, Huang Yufan, Patrick Zuo and Adam Wu contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Relatives of victims of Yangtze River cruise ship disaster have gathered in Jianli, closest city to where ship Oriental Star capsized, and are expressing frustration with lack of official explanations; some relatives have questioned official accounts of what happened in ship's final hours.
lead_paragraph: With no hope of finding survivors in the submerged hull of a cruise ship that capsized this week with 456 people aboard, officials turned their attention on Friday to recovering the dead.

headline.main: More Bodies Are Found as Yangtze Ship Is Lifted
headline.print_headline: Families of Victims in Ship Sinking Accuse Officials of Trying to Muzzle Anger

snippet: With no hope of finding survivors in the submerged hull of a cruise ship that capsized this week with 456 people aboard, officials turned their attention on Friday to recovering the dead.
